memberdef.definition: using Base = CVBase<MLAlgorithm, MatType, PredictionsType, WeightsType>
memberdef.name: Base

briefdescription.para: A short alias for CVBase.
An auxiliary object.
The size of each bin in terms of data points.
The number of bins in the dataset.
The original size of the dataset.
A pointer to a model from the last run of k-fold cross-validation.
The extended (by repeating the first k - 2 bins) weights.
The extended (by repeating the first k - 2 bins) data points.
The extended (by repeating the first k - 2 bins) predictions.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const PredictionsType &ys, const size_t numClasses, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for multiclass classification algorithms that can take a data::DatasetInfo parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Type information for each dimension of the dataset.
Labels for each data point.
Number of classes in the dataset.
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const data::DatasetInfo &datasetInfo, const PredictionsType &ys, const size_t numClasses, const WeightsType &weights, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for multiclass classification algorithms that can take a data::DatasetInfo parameter and support weighted learning.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Type information for each dimension of the dataset.
Labels for each data point.
Number of classes in the dataset.
Observation weights (for boosting).
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for regression algorithms and for binary classification algorithms.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Predictions (labels for classification algorithms and responses for regression algorithms) for each data point.
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const size_t numClasses, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for multiclass classification algorithms.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Labels for each data point.
Number of classes in the dataset.
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const size_t numClasses, const WeightsType &weights, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for multiclass classification algorithms that support weighted learning.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Labels for each data point.
Number of classes in the dataset.
Observation weights (for boosting).
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const WeightsType &weights, const bool shuffle=true)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: This constructor can be used for regression and binary classification algorithms that support weighted learning.

parameterdescription.para: Number of folds (should be at least 2).
Data points to cross-validate on.
Predictions (labels for classification algorithms and responses for regression algorithms) for each data point.
Observation weights (for boosting).
Whether or not to shuffle the data during construction.

briefdescription.para: Run k-fold cross-validation.

parameterdescription.para: Arguments for MLAlgorithm (in addition to the passed ones in the constructor).

briefdescription.para: Access and modify a model from the last run of k-fold cross-validation.
Shuffle the data.

detaileddescription.para: This overload is called if weights are not supported by the model type.

briefdescription.para: Shuffle the data.

detaileddescription.para: This overload is called if weights are supported by the model type.

memberdef.argsstring: (Base &&base, const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const bool shuffle)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: Assert the k parameter and data consistency and initialize fields required for running k-fold cross-validation.

memberdef.argsstring: (Base &&base, const size_t k, const MatType &xs, const PredictionsType &ys, const WeightsType &weights, const bool shuffle)
memberdef.name: KFoldCV

briefdescription.para: Assert the k parameter and data consistency and initialize fields required for running k-fold cross-validation in the case of weighted learning.
Get the ith training subset from a variable of a matrix type.
Get the ith training subset from a variable of a row type.
Get the ith validation subset from a variable of a matrix type.
Get the ith validation subset from a variable of a row type.
Initialize the given destination matrix with the given source joined with its first k - 2 bins.
Train and run evaluation in the case of non-weighted learning.
Train and run evaluation in the case of supporting weighted learning.
Calculate the index of the first column of the ith validation subset.

detaileddescription.para: We take the ith validation subset after the ith training subset if i < k - 1 and before it otherwise.

briefdescription.para: The class KFoldCV implements k-fold cross-validation for regression and classification algorithms.

detaileddescription.para: To construct a KFoldCV object you need to pass the k parameter and arguments that specify data. For example, you can run 10-fold cross-validation for SoftmaxRegression in the following way.

Before calling Evaluate(), it is possible to shuffle the data by calling the Shuffle() function. Shuffling is performed at construction time if the parameter shuffle is set to true in the constructor.

parameterdescription.para: A machine learning algorithm.
A metric to assess the quality of a trained model.
The type of data.
The type of predictions (should be passed when the predictions type is a template parameter in Train methods of MLAlgorithm).
The type of weights (should be passed when weighted learning is supported, and the weights type is a template parameter in Train methods of MLAlgorithm).
